metadata.original_utterance: The timeline shows clear dependencies between tasks

scenario.title: Q2 Website Redesign Project Planning Meeting
scenario.context: The team met to finalize the Q2 website redesign project plan, review the proposed timeline, and confirm task dependencies before development begins. The goal was to ensure alignment on sequencing and resource allocation.
discussion_points: Reviewed the updated Gantt chart showing phases: UX Design, Content Creation, Front-End Development, Back-End Integration, and QA Testing.

Discussed dependencies: Content Creation cannot start until UX wireframes are approved; Front-End Development depends on finalized content and approved UX designs; Back-End Integration starts after Front-End templates are stable.
Confirmed that QA Testing will only begin once both Front-End and Back-End tasks are complete.
action_items_discussed: Laura to circulate the final timeline with dependencies highlighted by EOD.
David to finalize wireframes by March 20 to unblock Content Creation.
Priya to prepare front-end framework setup while waiting for content sign-off.
known_constraints: Marketing campaign launch fixed for June 15, so all tasks must be completed by June 10.
Content team has limited availability in April due to another campaign.
stated_assumptions: Assuming no major scope changes after wireframe approval.
Assuming QA resources will be available starting May 20.

workback_plan:
# Workback Plan: Q2 Website Redesign Project

**Goal:** Complete the Q2 website redesign project by June 10, ensuring all dependencies are respected and the marketing campaign can launch on June 15.

**Meeting Reference:** Q2 Website Redesign Project Planning Meeting (2025-03-10, 10:00 AM PST)

**Artifacts:** Website_Redesign_ProjectPlan_v2.pdf, GanttChart_Timeline_March2025.png

---

## Timeline Overview
| T-n  | Date       | Task                                                                | Owner                              | Deliverable                          | Status      |
|------|------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------|--------------------------------------|-------------|
| T-90 | 2025-03-10 | Circulate final timeline with dependencies                          | Laura Chen (Project Manager)       | Finalized timeline document          | Pending     |
| T-80 | 2025-03-20 | Finalize UX wireframes                                              | David Morales (Lead UX Designer)   | Approved UX wireframes               | Pending     |
| T-70 | 2025-03-21 | Start Content Creation (after wireframes approved)                  | Sofia Ramirez (Content Strategist) | Draft website content                | Not Started |
| T-60 | 2025-04-05 | Prepare front-end framework setup (can start in parallel)           | Priya Singh (Front-End Developer)  | Front-end framework ready            | In Progress |
| T-50 | 2025-04-15 | Begin Front-End Development (after content finalized & UX approved) | Priya Singh (Front-End Developer)  | Front-end templates implemented      | Not Started |
| T-40 | 2025-05-01 | Start Back-End Integration (after front-end templates stable)       | James O'Neill (Back-End Developer) | Integrated back-end functionality    | Not Started |
| T-20 | 2025-05-20 | Begin QA Testing (after front-end & back-end complete)              | QA Team (assumed available)        | QA test report                       | Not Started |
| T-0  | 2025-06-10 | Final Launch Readiness                                              | Laura Chen (Project Manager)       | Approved site for marketing campaign | Not Started |

---

## Dependencies
- **Content Creation** → depends on **UX wireframes approval** (David → Sofia)
- **Front-End Development** → depends on **finalized content** and **approved UX designs** (Sofia & David → Priya)
- **Back-End Integration** → depends on **stable front-end templates** (Priya → James)
- **QA Testing** → depends on **completion of both front-end and back-end tasks** (Priya & James → QA Team)

These dependencies are based on planning discussions and reflected in GanttChart_Timeline_March2025.png.

---

## Blockers & Mitigation
| Blocker                                     | Mitigation                                       | Owner                              |
|---------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------|
| Content team limited availability in April  | Prioritize early content drafting after March 20 | Sofia Ramirez (Content Strategist) |
| QA resources only available starting May 20 | Ensure front-end and back-end complete by May 19 | Laura Chen (Project Manager)       |

---

## Assumptions
- No major scope changes after wireframe approval. **Impact if invalidated:** Could delay entire timeline.
- QA resources available starting May 20. **Impact if invalidated:** Testing phase may slip, risking June 10 deadline.

---

## Next Steps
- Laura Chen to circulate finalized timeline by EOD 2025-03-10.
- David Morales to deliver approved wireframes by 2025-03-20.
- Sofia Ramirez to begin content drafting immediately after wireframe approval.
- Priya Singh to set up front-end framework in parallel to content work.

assertions.text: The workback plan includes clear dependencies between [TASK]s.
assertions.original_text: The timeline shows clear dependencies between tasks

rationale.mapping_reason: The assertion checks whether the plan explicitly shows dependencies between tasks, which is a core requirement under S6 that ensures sequencing and risk awareness in the workback plan.

assertion_results.evidence: The 'Dependencies' section in the WBP explicitly lists relationships such as 'Content Creation → depends on UX wireframes approval', 'Front-End Development → depends on finalized content and approved UX designs', 'Back-End Integration → depends on stable front-end templates', and 'QA Testing → depends on completion of both front-end and back-end tasks'.
assertion_results.ground_truth_check: Scenario discussion points confirm these dependencies: Content Creation cannot start until UX wireframes are approved; Front-End Development depends on finalized content and approved UX designs; Back-End Integration starts after Front-End templates are stable; QA Testing begins once both Front-End and Back-End tasks are complete.
assertion_results.reasoning: The WBP clearly includes dependencies between tasks, and they are structurally represented in a dedicated section, satisfying the structural requirement.

assertion_results.evidence: Dependencies in the WBP match the scenario's discussion points: (1) Content Creation after UX wireframes approval, (2) Front-End Development after content finalized and UX approved, (3) Back-End Integration after front-end templates stable, (4) QA Testing after both front-end and back-end complete.
assertion_results.ground_truth_check: Scenario discussion points explicitly mention these same dependencies during the planning discussion.
assertion_results.reasoning: All dependencies in the WBP correspond to real issues raised in the scenario, and no extra or hallucinated dependencies were introduced. Therefore, the grounding requirement is met.

assertions.text: Dependencies shown in the timeline must correspond to real action items or issues raised during the planning discussion.
assertions.original_text: The timeline shows clear dependencies between tasks

rationale.mapping_reason: The assertion checks whether the timeline shows clear dependencies between tasks, which implies that these dependencies should be traceable and grounded in actual action items or issues discussed.
